column2: REFILE-Activision Blizzard revenue forecast missesBRIEF-Activision Blizzard reports Q4 gaap earnings $0.49/shareUPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares)  UPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares) * Q4 gaap earnings per share $0.49; Q4 gaap net revenue $1.58 billion versus. $1.52 billion last yearUPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares)   BRIEF-Activision Blizzard reports Q4 gaap earnings $0.49/shareUPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares)  UPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares) * Q4 gaap earnings per share $0.49; Q4 gaap net revenue $1.58 billion versus. $1.52 billion last yearUPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares)  Feb 5 Videogame maker Activision Blizzard Inc
column3: known for its "Call of Duty"
column4: "Destiny" and "World of Warcraft" titles
column5: forecast revenue for the first quarter below average analyst expectation
column6: factoring in the impact of a strengthening dollar.BRIEF-Activision Blizzard reports Q4 gaap earnings $0.49/shareUPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares)  UPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares) * Q4 gaap earnings per share $0.49; Q4 gaap net revenue $1.58 billion versus. $1.52 billion last yearUPDATE 2-Strong dollar weighs on game maker Activision Blizzard's forecast * Shares down 8.3 pct post market   (Adds CFO and analyst comments; updates shares)

column2: UPDATE 1-Allstate profit beats estimates as premiums rise Feb 4 Allstate Corp
column3: the largest publicly traded home and auto insurer in the United States
column4: reported a higher-than-expected quarterly profit as it earned more premiums
column5: and the company said it would buy back $3 billion in shares.

column2: Verizon to sell wireline operations and towers worth over $15 bln SAN FRANCISCO Verizon Communications Inc  will sell wireline assets to Frontier Communications Corp  for $10.54 billion in cash and cell phone towers worth over $5 billion to American Tower Corp
column3: the company said on Thursday.

column39102: while news Pfizer would buy Hospira in a massive deal further boosted the market. | Video        (Reuters Breakingviews) - Pfizer has made more than its share of value-destroying acquisitions. The pharmaceutical giant's $15 billion purchase of Hospira could reverse that history. The injectable-drug maker's strength in non-branded medications should boost Pfizer's own generics unit - and open the way for spinning it off.US STOCKS-Wall St climbs with energy bounce
